help_document.overview: Grouping Affy Arrays is the first step of the analysis pipeline. To Start a new session follow the instructions below. Remember that arrays from many different projects can grouped together

summary.name: Find the Analysis Tab
summary.description: Follow the steps below to get to the page to start grouping together Affy files or Click the link

extra_data.description: Click on the "File Groups" tab to start a new session

all_steps.step: Select the Microarray Link in the main navigation bar
Select the Project of interest at the top of the page
Select the Data Pipeline Button on the main navigation bar
If the project has Affy data a link to "Affy Analysis Pipeline" will be displayed at the bottom of the page, Click the link

summary.name: Start a new Analysis Session
summary.description: Click the Start New Analysis Session button to start selecting arrays.

summary.name: Select Arrays
summary.description: Click on the project of interest. Arrays within that project will show up below. Use the checkboxes to select the arrays for analysis. You can select arrays from different projects. T

all_steps.step: Click on any of the column headers to sort the rows
Click the check box at the top of the arrays to select/de-select all arrays

summary.name: View Selected Arrays
summary.description: As arrays are selected they will show up in the upper portion of the window. To add additional arrays go, select a new project and select the arrays of interest.

summary.name: Go to Normalization Section
summary.description: Once all the arrays are selected click on the "Start Normalization" button

extra_data.description: Learn more about starting a normalization run

summary.name: Go Back to the Pipeline Overview
summary.description: Go Back to the Pipeline Overview
